author: Subha J
text:
Actors, directors and musicians spoke about their experiences working with Ilaiyaraaja.—Photo: Special Arrangement

Star after star from the film industry took the opportunity that ‘Ilaiyaraaja Aayiram’ provided to speak about just how much his music has touched them. It's not easy to encompass the maestro’s music in an evening, but they tried, and how!

The show, organised by Vijay TV and Ilaiyaraaja Music N Management Pvt. Ltd., and featuring the orchestra that plays for him, began with an invocation to the Almighty.

When the maestro entered the venue, YMCA grounds, Nandanam, a display of fireworks lit up the sky above. And then, the audience, numbering about 15,000 people, gave him a standing ovation.

An instrumental medley of his hit numbers was followed by a performance by veteran musicians Vikku Vinayakram (ghatam) and T.V. Gopalakrishnan, who taught Ilaiyaraaja classical music. TVG spoke fondly about the composer who meant more than a student to him.

Next up was the turn of Panchu Arunachalam, who introduced him in Annakili , and Bala, whose Thaarai Thappattai was Ilaiyaraaja’s 1000th film.

Actor-director R. Parthiban got directors who’ve worked closely with Ilaiyaraaja — Balki, P. Vasu, Prakashraj, K. Bhagyaraj, P. Vasu and Mysskin — to share their experiences.
title: An ode to the maestro
